notesStmt.note: Incomplete at the beginning. Damaged by dampness.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Maimonides' Commentary on the Mishnah of Seder neziḳin, in Judeo-Arabic, preceded by a fragment of the same commentary on Seder nashim.

msItem.title: Perush Seder neziḳin פרוש סדר נזקין

collation.p: 21 quires: i4 (folios 13-16); ii10-1 (folio 17-25); iii-xxxi10 (folios 26-315); xxxii10-1 (folios 316-324); xxxiii5 (folios 325-329). Folios 1-11 are a separate fragment, and folio 12 is a recent addition. Quires signed with Hebrew letters at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 14th to 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Maimonides' Commentary Seder Nezikin. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2393.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 23 July 1881: inscribed, [330v].
